H0.text: In 2009 to what did the United Kingdom’s largest insurance company, Norwich Union, change its name. Aviva UK

H1.text: In 2009 to what did the United Kingdom’s largest insurance company, Norwich Union, change its name. NU Insurance

H2.text: In 2009 to what did the United Kingdom’s largest insurance company, Norwich Union, change its name. Britannia Insurance

H3.text: In 2009 to what did the United Kingdom’s largest insurance company, Norwich Union, change its name. CGNU

A4.text: In April 2002, the company's shareholders voted to change the company name to Aviva plc, an invented palindrome word derived from 'viva', the Latin for 'alive' and designed to be short, memorable and work worldwide.

A5.text: In April 2008, Aviva announced that it would adopt the Aviva name as its worldwide consumer-facing brand, and that the Norwich Union brand would be phased out in the United Kingdom.

A6.text: On 1 June 2009, Norwich Union was rebranded as Aviva.

A7.text: In 2000, it merged with CGU, to form CGNU, which became Aviva.
